text: Tile type (ceramic, porcelain, mosaic, natural stone) matches submittals and finish schedule
Adhesives, grout, waterproofing membranes, and expansion joints approved and on-site
Tile size, color, pattern, and trim/accessory pieces confirmed prior to install
Substrate/backer board type and condition verified (Durock, Schluter, cement board, etc.)
Substrate level, clean, dry, and cured (for concrete)
Sloped to drain (for showers, wet rooms, exterior areas)
Crack isolation membrane installed if required by spec
Waterproofing membrane installed at wet areas, shower walls, pans, etc.
Waterproofing properly cured and flood-tested if required
Tiles laid per pattern (grid, brick, diagonal) and aligned with control joints
Mortar bed coverage >90% at wet areas, >80% at dry areas
Tile joints uniform in width and spacing
Movement joints installed where required (floor transitions, perimeters)
Grout type and color approved and consistent
Grout joints clean, fully filled, and flush with tile surface
Transition trims installed cleanly at changes in flooring or wall finish
No lippage or cracked tiles
Surface cleaned and free from haze, residue, or construction dust
All tile edges properly caulked or grouted (no voids or excessive silicone)
Consultant or owner walkthrough completed and signoff received
